title: ICE when include_bytes-ing ~>1GB of data in lib.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code `dd if=/dev/random of=file bs=1G count=1` ```Rust // Cargo.toml [package] name = "ice" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" ``` ```Rust // lib.rs const _FILE &[u8] = include_bytes!("../file"); ``` I was not able to reproduce the crash when I moved the code to main.rs. Including one ~750MB file did not cause a crash, but including both a ~750MB file and a ~250MB file did. ### Meta Was able to reproduce on stable and nightly `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.64.0 (a55dd71d5 2022-09-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52 commit-date: 2022-09-19 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.64.0 LLVM version: 14.0.6 ``` `rustc +nightly --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.66.0-nightly (bed4ad65b 2022-10-25) binary: rustc commit-hash: bed4ad65bf7a1cef39e3d66b3670189581b3b073 commit-date: 2022-10-25 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.66.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.2 ``` ### Error output When running `cargo (+nightly) check` ``` thread '' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: TryFromIntError(())', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/table.rs:234:49 ```
Backtrace
